xvGroup.xe: Who is he angry with?

xvGroup.xn: रिसाएको मान्छेसंग कुरा गर्नु नमीठो हुन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: It is not pleasant to talk to an angry person.
That conversation made me angry.
I bought a hat.
I bought a hat for myself.
One has to put children to sleep gently.

xvGroup.xv: bʌ̄ŋpɛ saman ʔɛstɛnʌ ʔibîiti molo phoso ʔiʔipiti.
xvGroup.xn: राम्रो सामान हो भनेर दियो तर हामीलाई फसाई दियो ।
xvGroup.xe: He said that it was a good product and gave it to us, but he cheated us.
I took care of an orphan.

xvGroup.xv: ɖʌkʈʌrʔɛ mʌ̂nnɛ khɛppɛ ŋeçpɛ ɦʌs ʔʉtɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The doctor saved the sick person who was about to die.

xvGroup.xv: titi titi ghoɔ̄lpɛ buplaɦɛm bhɵ̄ːlɛ bhɵ̄ːlɛ ʔʉ̂ŋtʌnu.
xvGroup.xn: सानो सानो चल्‍लाहरुलाई बल्‍ला बल्‍ला बचाएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: We saved the chicks with difficulty.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋ ŋeçpɛ muŋʌtam bhɵ̄ːlɛ bhɵ̄ːlɛ ʔʉ̂nsiŋʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: म बिरामी थिएँ बल्‍ला बल्‍ला बाँचेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: As I was sick, I survived with difficulty.
The tree fell down.
The wind broke the tree.
The banana tree broke under the weight of iʦ fruits.
He puts a potato in his mouth.

xvGroup.xv: gɵ̄ːthɛ jokkilo ɦūːsʌŋ ʔʌ̄lnɛnʌ khoɔ̂nnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: When we move the cowshed, we have to uproot the vertical pole and take it away.

xvGroup.xv: ʦɵʦʦɵpo ŋʌlu ɦʌllei ʦhûː jo ʔʌ̄lkinʌkho nuri ŋʌlu bʌ̄ŋpɛ lʌ̄m.
xvGroup.xn: केटाकेटीको दाँत हल्लिने बित्तिकै उखालेमा नयाँ दाँत राम्रो उम्रिन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: If we take out the children teeth when they are loose, the new teeth grow well.

xvGroup.xv: sʌ̄ŋbi thânpɛ kaʈi ʣʌmʌrʌʔɛ ʔʌ̄lnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: काठमा ठोकेको काँटी जमराले उखाल्नु पर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: We have to take out the nails that have been nailed into the wood with a hammer.
He tore the clothes.
The food cooked yesterday was left unfinished.
He left the food unfinished.

xvGroup.xv: disɛ̂ː po lagi jûː ʔēisinɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: We have to leave some food for tomorrow.
The sun overheated the buffalo.
We have to warm the bread in the fire.
The fire warmed me up.
The water overflowed and spilled over.
The milk boiled and overflowed.

psGroup.ng: Conjugates like an intransitive verb but iʦ agent requires the ergative suffix.

xvGroup.xe: They said ``We're going to the market".
We will be careful of what we say.
Did I say that?
I bend the bamboo.
He looked from the side (with his upper body bent in half).
The shaman expelled the bad spirits.

xvGroup.xn: मुख फराखिलो भएको ठूलो डोको बुन्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He wove a basket with a wide funnel-shaped opening.

xvGroup.xv: kunabi tɵ̂npɛ kʉ̂r kʌ̄r belabi ʔɛ̄lnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: When taking a load that was laid on a terrace wall, one has to pull it forward.
They lifted the boulder with a crowbar.
My nail came off when I bumped my foot.
The rooster crowed in the morning.
The wood bent as the sun dried it.

psGroup.ge: put (one's head) halfway into a window or door

xvGroup.xe: He put his head halfway into the door.
I sat down by the fire.
I returned to my village from Kathmandu.
We came back to Phuleli from Kanku.
When I plough fields, I make the ox turn around.
It is not good to take revenge for small matters.
I brought back the comb for myself (I left other things in some place but I brought back the comb)
The nagi shaman pronounced ritual words pertaining to the nagi.
The priest who performs death rituals pronounced ritual words pertaining to the funeral.
He killed the deer by shooting with his bow.
I shot myself with an arrow.
The sun rose.
The locust jumped.
The flea jumped.
The millet ripened.

psGroup.ge: break (the cob of the corn in such a way that the stalks remain in place)

xvGroup.xe: He broke the cob of the corn.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ mʌkʌi muʔoɔ̂rsʌtwʌlo ʔʌ̄m ʔuʦîlʔɛ ʔoɔ̂rtɛ
xvGroup.xn: मैले उस्को मकै भाँची नदिँदा उ रिस्ले चुर भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: When I did not break off the ears of corn for him, he became very angry.
Frogs croak at night in the spring.

xvGroup.xn: माम्री भएको भाँडामा ढिँडो ओडाल्न पानी बसाल्द तातो र चिसोको प्रातिक्रिया हुँदा निस्कने फट्फटाउदो अवाज
xvGroup.xe: The water bubbled up in the cooking pot.
After we take a loan, we have to reimburse it.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ phʌ̄l jûː mujɛtwɛ wôːne mēːnʌ ʔɵ̂lsʉtɛ.

psGroup.xn: उसले ढिँडो मन पराएन कि के हो त्यासैले ओकल्दियो ।
psGroup.xe: He seemed not to like the millet porridge so he spit it out.

xvGroup.xe: The tiger ate the goat.
I eat meat.
I peel the potato (with my nails).
He peeled the bamboo.
I hoe the field.
Snakes bite.
The hen pecked the chick.
I put the pot on the fireplace.

xvGroup.xv: mɵ̂l mʉkilo kinɛ munʉ, bʌ̄ŋpɛ muʦhûː.
xvGroup.xn: सल्लाह गर्दा झगडा गर्नु राम्रो हुँदैन ।
xvGroup.xe: When we have a discussion, it is not good to argue.
I tie the rope.

psGroup.ge: bend into a circle, tighten (by screwing)

xvGroup.xe: He bent the edge of the basket.
Tighten the lid of the gourd.

psGroup.ge: hurt people's feelings, threaten for no reason

xvGroup.xe: He hurt his feelings.
He made tweezers.
He watered the garden.

xvGroup.xv: gagribi ku kurutʌlo ʔûŋ kuʔɛ ʔikʉstʌ.
xvGroup.xn: गाग्रीमा पानी बोक्दा मलाई पानीले भिजायो ।
xvGroup.xe: I got wet while carrying the pitcher.
He stored the curd into the pitcher.
They stretched the measuring tape to measure the field.
He pulled the child's ear.
They stretched the thread.
The cat woke up and stretched itself.
He carried a heavy load.

xvGroup.xn: उसले मलाई विदेशबाट राम्रो घडी ल्याइदियो ।
xvGroup.xe: He brought me a nice watch from abroad.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʦɵ kʉ̂rtɛ̂m suk mʌɦinʌ dôː.
xvGroup.xn: उनी गर्भवती भएकी तीन महिना भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: She is three months pregnant.
I carry food for myself.
The bird brought food for its young.
I brought you a present.
I pick pumpkin seeds (to eat them).
I pick lice.
The tea got cold.
When we catch a cold, it is better not to go jumping around.
The playground of the forest spirit (placename).
I climbed up the chilaune (Schima wallichii).
The monkey climbs up the cliff.
I climbed the mountain.
He pasted the notice (on the board)
The wasp stung me.
Today he was stung by a nettle.
Yesterday morning the wind blew very strongly.

xvGroup.xv: biʣʌmlâlʔɛ dɛ̄mjoŋ pɵnɛpo lagi tēr kêltɛ.
xvGroup.xe: Bijamlal peeled the skin off the bamboo to weave a flat basket.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûː ʣhōŋpɛʔɛ ʔûː ʣhōːnɛ phulubi ʔunʔûː kêltʉtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: बारी जोत्‍नेले बारी जोत्‍ने पर्ममा ठूल्ठूलो सोया बनाई राख्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The ploughman ploughed their field in rough way in a mutual exchange of labor.
The dog bites the cat.
Gnats sting.
I bit myself.

xvGroup.xv: sʌ̄ŋkʌrmiʔɛ ʣhɛl bʌnei mʉnɛ sʌ̄ŋ kɛ̂ntɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The carpenter bore a hole in the wood to make a window.
She pierced her ear to wear an earring.
Have some more chang!

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋ khɛpʦi tibi tūŋ ghole kɛpsɵʦʌje.
xvGroup.xe: Give me some more money.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌnɵ̂l tibi tūŋ ʣhūŋ lʉpɛ gɵmîmʔɛ ʔûŋ tibi gɵ kɛ̂msiŋʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: आज अलिक बढी जाडो भएकोले मैले अलिक लुगा थपेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: Today is a bit colder so I put on some more clothes.
I chew rice.
The cow chews (the bark of) the branches of the Ficus sarmentosa.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m ʦiʔɛ sēːdʉlo tûːŋʌ brâː kɛ̂mʣɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उ मातेको बेला एउटै कुरा चपाइरहन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When he is drunk, he keeps on saying the same words.

psGroup.ge: cluster together, put one's hair in a bun

xvGroup.xe: The bear (climbed the tree and) clustered all the branches together (to make a place to rest).

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʔudhōːsʌm ʦulʈho kɛ̂ltɛnʌ kɛ̄m mʉtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले कपाल चुल्ठी बाँधेर काम गर्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: She put her hair into a bun and worked.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuʔûːbi woŋâmʔɛ sʌ̄ŋ ghas mʌrʌ̄inɛpo lagi ʔʌ̄mʔɛ mʌ̄nʦʌp kɛ̂ltɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उस्को बारीमा अरुले घास दाउरा नकाट्नाको लागि उसले चुल्ठो बाँध्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He attached the planʦ (in the shape of women's hair as a sign) so that people would not cut plants from his fields.

xvGroup.xv: ʣɛkoɔ̄i mʌtnije ʔɛ̂nnɛʔɛ dephu was nērnʌ ʣɛlʌm kɛ̂lnu.
xvGroup.xn: अन्‍नबाली सप्रियोस भनी उभौली भूमे सकेपछि ज्यलम् पूजिन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: In order to get good crops, they perform the Jyalam ceremony after the Waas festival.

xvGroup.xv: lūːʣʌjûː kɛ̄lsʌ ʔɛʣɛ̄ːsʌmmʌ sɛ̄mkîm khijo mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: कोदोको ढीँडो मस्काएर धेरै बेरसम्म बफाएको नरम हुन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: If we steam the millet porridge for a long time after having stirred it, it becomes soft.
I know how to sing.
I cut the meat.
The ice froze the potatoes.

xvGroup.xn: हिउँदमा हिउँ पर्दा हिउँले आलु जन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When there is snow in winter, it freezes the potatoes.

psGroup.ge: winnow (blow the chaff with the wind)

xvGroup.xe: I winnowed the millet (in the wind).

xvGroup.xn: उसले सुनेको कुरा अरु सबैलाई भन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: He tells everybody what he hears.
I wear clothes.
We roofed the house with stone slates.

xvGroup.xv: dhōːʦer ʔûːbi wōŋpɛ phɵ ʔuŋʌ koɔ̄ldunu.
xvGroup.xe: I chase the chickens which enter the wheat field.
I follow the people who are walking ahead.
The dog chased the jackal.
He forced him to eat rice.
The brambles got stuck in the water pipe.
I forced myself to eat meal.

psGroup.ge: become dry and hard (land), suffer from hypothermia

xvGroup.xe: The paddy field dried up.
I suffered from hypothermia.
I have stomach cramps.
I slice the potato to cook curry.
They sawed the wood.
I cut the rice with a sickle.
I close my eyes when I sleep.
The tiger roared.
I hesitated to ask.
The bed tingles me. REVISE
I fixed the handle of the axe.
The ice is frozen on the mountains.
We are frozen in winter.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ ʔʌkʌ̄m tûː mʌ̄ina ghoktûŋtâm, ʔɛ̂n klêːnɛ mʌçpɛ ʦhʉktɛ.
xvGroup.xn: मैले मेरो घर एक महिनावरको लागी छोडेको थिएँ, अब लिप्‍नु पर्ने भएको छ ।
xvGroup.xe: I left the house for one month, now we have to plaster the ground.
Rub oil on your baby.

xvGroup.xv: bîrmɵ ghiu ʔuʣɵʣɵ dâː ɦʌskolo mʌri klênsi.
xvGroup.xn: बिरालो घिउ खान खोज्दा मान्छेसंग धेरै ढेस्सिन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: REVISE
He stitched the dhajura with a pin.
I felt shy in front of my in-law.
I felt shy.
I felt shy.
We cooked meat curry.
I cook curry.
He tied the grass with a long rope.
Let's tie it with a thread.
I start weaving the basket.
We started weaving the basket.
He can touch the ceiling.

xvGroup.xn: आलु फल्ने बेला बोटको वरिपरि माटो दिने क्रियाकलाप वा गोर्नु ।
xvGroup.xe: One has to add soil around the stalk before it bears potatoes.
I combed my hair.
Today I bathed and combed my hair.

xvGroup.xn: आलु फल्‍नु अगाडी आलुको बोट वरिपरि माटो दिनुपर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: One has to add soil around the stalk before it bears potatoes.
I drunk tongba and fell down.
The child fell headfirst from the terrace wall.
We sticked a pole to tie cows.

xvGroup.xn: गरोमा बच्‍चा लड्दा टाउको मुनि भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: The child fell headfirst on the terrace wall.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌmiski dʌla muʔʌ̂msiŋʌwʌ, ʔʌnɵ̂l simʉwɛʔɛ ʔikhʌ̄iŋʌ.
xvGroup.xe: Yesterday I did not sleep in time, so today I am dozing off.
I doze off.

xvGroup.xv: gɵ̄ːthɛpo kilo khʌ̄ikilo, pɵk gɵkde bʌjʌbi mʌdhuksʌ khʌ̄isi.
xvGroup.xn: गोठको किलो गाड्दा माटो भएको ठाउँमा नठोकीईकन गाडिन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When we stick the pole of the cowshed on earth, it goes without hitting a stone.
The water powers the mill.
I turn the grinding stone.
When we dance Waas, we turn from the right.
The earth rotates from west to east.

xvGroup.xn: हाम्रो कामको लागि म गाउँमा घुमेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I went around in the village for our work.
The thief stole money.
The rice burned.
I hang corn on the rack over the oven.
We hang the clothes.

psGroup.ge: be clumsy, break anything one touches
psGroup.ng: normally used in inverse negative forms

xvGroup.xe: He breaks anything he touches. (Nothing lasts in his hands)
Nothing lasts in my hands.
It is too salty.
Bittergourd is bitter.

psGroup.ge: block, squeeze into (as in a door)

xvGroup.xe: A pond was formed by blocking the water.

xvGroup.xv: balibi bʌ̂i mʌwōːnɛpo lagi lɛ̄m khɛ̂npɛ gɵ.
xvGroup.xn: बालीमा गाई नपस्‍नको लागि बाटो थुनेको छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The path is blocked so that the cow cannot go into the crops.

xvGroup.xv: ʦɵʦʦɵpo ʔukhʌ̄r laskʌʔɛ khɛttɛnʌ koɔ̄r ʦhʉktɛ.
xvGroup.xn: बच्‍चाको हात ढोकाले च्यापेर घाउ भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: The child's hand was wounded after being trapped in the door.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʔûː ʣhɵ̄ːŋʉlo ʔuʦhēu ʦhīːmʉ mʌnʌ ʔukuna khɛttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: When he ploughs field, he ploughs nicely from the first row up to the terrace wall.
Water accumulated.
The bananas are about to ripe.
The day is about to break.
I am about to go abroad.

xvGroup.xn: अब म सुत्‍न लागि रहेको छु ।
xvGroup.xe: Now I am about to sleep.

xvGroup.xn: मैले गोठको घारामा डोरीले चित्र बाँधेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I attached the bamboo mat on the cowshed with a thread. (the thread is attached between the bamboo splints)

xvGroup.xv: kōlbi tori khɛ̄lsʌ tēl lɛ̂nnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: We extract oil by crushing the mustard seed in the seed-crusher.
He pressured the thief and inquired.
I shave my hair.
I have to shave.
Yesterday I came up to your house.
I brought up firewood.
I went to see the house.
I go to college.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m phʌrʌm khɛ̂i mʉkbi dorphu bʌʣar khɵstɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उ अदुवा बेच्न दोर्फु बजार गयो ।
xvGroup.xe: He went to Dorphu bazaar to sell ginger.
He went to the bookshop to buy books.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌnɵ̂l rɵ̂ː jâː mʉnɛ dûː khɵstɛ.
xvGroup.xe: Today people planted rice very efficiently.
The tiger took away the goat.
The landslide swept the paddy fields.

xvGroup.xv: ʔiskulbi jâː mʉnɛ jakki pūŋmɛpo ʔukhāŋ khoɔttʌ.
xvGroup.xn: स्कुलमा रोप्‍नलाई सानो फूलको बिरुवा लगेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I took a small flower plant to plant at the school.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ naspʌti khɛ̂i mʉnɛ dorphu bʌʣar khoɔttɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले नास्पाती बेच्न दोर्फु बजार लग्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He took pears to sell at Dorphu bazaar.
I gathered dry leaves.
I gathered people for a discussion.
I amassed a lot of debt.
He gathered the sheep.
People gathered to plant rice.
He fried snacks for me.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄msu ʣhʌ̄mlʌ mʉssulo phʌ̄rkibi khoɔ̄r lʉ̂iti.
xvGroup.xn: उनीहरू लाप्पा खेल्दा धूलोमा दलादल गरे ।
xvGroup.xe: They got smeared in dirt while wrestling.

xvGroup.xv: ʦɛnupɛ koɔ̄i khʌpkilo mʌsʌlʌkolo tēlbi phoɔ̄lto khoɔ̄rnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: मीठो तर्कारी पकाउँदा मसलासँग तेलमा चलाउँदै भुट्नुपर्छ।
xvGroup.xe: We have to parch curry in oil with spices to make it tasty.
He snored while sleeping.
The mouse transports a lot of grain.
The truck transports stones to build a house.
He told my words to other people.
The ants transported their eggs.

psGroup.ge: help to walk (a child or a disabled person)

xvGroup.xv: ʦɵʦʦɵɦɛm lɛ̄mthinɛ muʦɛ̂ːpnu, thinu, wɛtɛ̄ː khrinɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: बच्‍चाहरु हिँड्नु सक्दैन, लड्छन्, बिस्तरै डोर्‍याउनुपर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When children are not able to walk, and fall down, we have to help them to walk slowly.

xvGroup.xn: मैले औँला भाचेर पैसा गन्ती गर्छु ।
xvGroup.xe: I count money on my fingers.
He recites the deusi very well during the Dipavali festival.
The cow stepped on the mud.
I stepped on the twig and broke it.

xvGroup.xn: पेट दुखेर धामीले मलाई सिया मन्सायो ।
xvGroup.xe: The shaman healed my indigestion.
I stepped in the mud and got an allergy.
He crunched the pop-corn.
I crunch almonds.

psGroup.ge: eat corn with both hands (cooked or very young corn cobs)

xvGroup.xe: I eat corn with both hands.

psGroup.ge: thread the weft through the warp

xvGroup.xe: I threaded the weft through the warp.
I covered the tea.
We have to cover well the alcohol in the jar.

psGroup.ge: be twisted, sprained (articulation), go the wrong way (machine, key)

xvGroup.xe: My knee is sprained.
His back got twisted.
I locked up the door.

xvGroup.xn: मृतकलाई हिजो जमीनमा गाडेर दाहसंस्कार गरे ।
xvGroup.xe: They buried the deceased person yesterday.
He buried the taro.
I sharpened the wooden spatula with a khukuri.
I peeled an apple.
I sharpen the plough with an adze.
I got burnt by the fire.
I got burnt by boiling water.

xvGroup.xn: भात पकाउँदा आगोले उस्को हात पाल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He was burnt by the fire as he cooked the meal.

xvGroup.xv: khɵleŋʌ jûː bîŋtʌnu molo tûː ʦʌ̄i khlɛ̂ːtûŋtʌ rʌiʦhʌ.
xvGroup.xn: सबैलाई भात दिएँ तर एकजनालाई बिराएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I gave food to everybody, but I apparently missed one person.
He misspoke and there was a dispute.
They burnt the pig's (hair) and scraped its skin.

xvGroup.xv: ki jâː mʉkilo kānla khlɛ̂nnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: When we plant potatoes, we have to scrape the terrace wall.

xvGroup.xn: उहिले कालो जादु गरेर बिगार्ने प्रथा थियो ।
xvGroup.xe: In old days, some people used to hurt other people by black magic.
He beat the grains with a pestle.
They kicked the man with their feet.
The child cannot reach the basket where grains are dried.
It is too far away for me to see it.
They hid some (information)
He hid the money.
We hid in the bamboo grove.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌnɵ̂l kɵ̂mʔɛ dhâm gʉ̂ltɛnʌ sāŋgʌr mutoɔ̂nnu.
xvGroup.xn: आज बादलले आकाश ढाकेर तारा देखिदैनन् ।
xvGroup.xe: The stars are not visible today as they are hidden by the clouds.
We covered the child with a piece of cloth.
I covered myself in a quilt when it snowed.
The chicks hatched.
The millet seeds germinated.
We have to keep flowers near the house.
He kept cows for milk.
The children go to school from their homes.
He often goes to Khumbu for work.
I filled the pitcher with water.
He got angry with me.

xvGroup.xn: हामी आफु बिच रिस गर्नु हुँदैन ।
xvGroup.xe: We should not be angry at each other.
He jumped accross the river.
I jumped over the pit.
My hand became numb because of the cold.
People feel numb from cold in winter.
The hen brooded its eggs.
The pigeon is brooding its eggs.
He agreed to do the work.
I did not agree to go.
The goat became entangled in the rope.

psGroup.ge: bury a baby away from the house
psGroup.gn: संस्कार्नु (बालक वा बालिकाको मृत्यु हुँदा गरिने खालिङ संस्कार)

xvGroup.xe: We buried the dead child.
The bamboo bent under the snow.
The snow bent the bamboo.
We bow when we greet someone.

psGroup.ge: bend (something very hard to bend, huge tree)

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ pɛ̂:p ʔukhāŋbi ŋʌ ghûmtʌnʌ bʌ̂i ʔughas bîŋtʌnu.
xvGroup.xn: मैले बाँस बोटमै निहुराएर गाईलाई घास खुवाएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I bent the bamboo trunk to give fodder to the cows.
When we make cowsheds, we have to bend the rafter.
The snow bent the bamboo.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m ʔiskul khɵstɛlo noɔ̄m tɛ̄inɛ khɛptɛnʌ ghʉ̂rtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उ स्कुल जाँदा ढीलो हुन लागेकोले छिटो दौड्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: When he was going to school it got late and he ran.
He made me run.
I drive the bus.

xvGroup.xv: lʌ̄ŋjʉ gɵpɛ sɵ khlêːpʔɛ lɛttɛnʌ ghʌ̂rtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: डोकोमा भएको मासु कुकुरले झिकेर कुदायो ।
xvGroup.xe: The dog took the meat from the basket and ran away with it.
My mother's heel cracked.
The earth is cracked.
The cloth was burnt by the fire and a hole formed in it.
The mouse made a hole in the sack of rice.

psGroup.ge: spread on a surface, put tighly together

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ sakpu ʦhēlmɛ ghɛ̂mtɛnʌ khoɔ̄r mʉtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले दुईवटा चित्र बँधेर खोर बाड्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He made a fence by joining two mats together.
The wood planks are finely fitted.

psGroup.ge: to get along, be on good terms with each other

xvGroup.xe: They started to get along.
The sun set at five o'clock.
I could not sleep last night.
We heated the bread.
I warmed myself up (by the fire).

psGroup.ge: block the way (and lead in another direction, of animals)

xvGroup.xe: He blocked the way for the chicken and lead it away.

psGroup.ue: With lɵ ``soul" as its object, this verb is used to refer to a type of death ritual.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m mistɛnʌ sak ɦʌptʌbi ʔulɵ ghɵ̂mtɛnu.
xvGroup.xn: ऊ बितेको दुईहप्‍तामा उस्को अन्तिम संस्कार गरे ।
xvGroup.xe: After two weeks of his passing away they performed his final death ritual.
The pig grew very big in one year.
This year we had big pumpkins.
It is not possible to cross big rivers.
Hold your dog!
I am feeling dizzy, hold me.
It became dark.

xvGroup.xv: dʌla kɛ̄mbi khoɔ̂nnɛ gɵ, ʔɛ̂n ʔûŋ ghrûnsiŋʌ.
xvGroup.xn: छिटो काममा जानु छ । अब म खाना बनाउँछ ।
xvGroup.xe: It is time to go to work soon, I will now cook the meal.
My work made me tired.

psGroup.ge: be lazy, be reluctant to do something (because one feels a little tired)

xvGroup.xn: त्यस बेला लिन जान अल्छि मान्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He didn't feel like fetching it at that time.
A torch lit up on the other side (of a hill).
I switch on the light.

xvGroup.xv: lɛ̄mdubi dumʌ ghrîmtɛnʌ ghɵ̂r ghrɛçsʌ kʌ̄m ɦɵ̂iti.
xvGroup.xn: बाटोमा रात परेर हामीहरु सिटा बालेर घर आयौं ।
xvGroup.xe: It got dark on the way so we came home lighting our torch.
I started a bush fire.
I am disgusted by the filth.
I am disgusted by snotty-nosed children.
I left my friend at the market.
I won at chess.
He beat me.

xvGroup.xn: यो पिंडालु खाडल अलिक गहिरो भएन ।
xvGroup.xe: This yam pit is not deep enough.
Khaling people have to worship the negi.
The storm broke off the top of the tree.
I emptied half the water pitcher.
He heard the noise.
You heard the song.
Walking in the forest, I was afraid of bears.
I was afraid of the ghost in the river.
When I walked in the forest, I feared the bears.
The tiger roared.
The river roared when it flooded.
The storm roared.
The tiger roared at me.
Dogs bark at people.
The tiger roars at the goat.
I have a headache.
The child longed for chocolate.

xvGroup.xn: बिरालोले घिउ खान मन गरी रहेको छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The cat longs for ghee.
I sat on the chair.
I make him sit on the chair.
I put the load on the resting platform.

xvGroup.xv: kʌrmiʔɛ kʌ̄m mʉtɛlo lɛ̂l kʌ̄mpo laskʌ ŋɛ̂ntɛ.
xvGroup.xn: कर्मीले घर बनाउँदा पहिला घरको ढोका राख्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: When the mason was building the house, he first installed the door.

psGroup.ge: turn blue from choking (cyanosis); have a hangdog look (after having been scolded)

xvGroup.xn: सिम्बल तरुल गला लाग्दा बच्‍चा नील्लै भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: The yam got stuck in the child's throat and he turned blue.

xvGroup.xn: बुवाले गाली गर्दा बच्‍चा नील्लै भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: After his father scolded him, the child had a hangdog look.

psGroup.ge: play a trick on someone, lie

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m ŋɛ̂ltɛnʌ koɔ̄ibi rʌ̄m dhuma ghole bektɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले हँसीमजाक गरेर तर्कारीमा नुन बढी हाल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He played a trick and put too much salt in the curry.

xvGroup.xv: dēlkʌmbi turetureŋâm ʦɵʦʦɵɦɛm mununʌkho mʌri ŋɛ̄lnu.
xvGroup.xn: गाउँघरमा उस्त-उस्तै केटाकेटीहरु छन् भने फटाँइ काम गर्छन् ।
xvGroup.xe: If there many like-minded children in the village, they will be naughty.
I don't like to be naughty.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûː ʣhōŋkilo ʔubhɵ̂l gɵpɛ goru mʌri ŋɛ̄l.
xvGroup.xn: खेत जोत्दा बल्ले गोरुले सीधा तान्दैन ।
xvGroup.xe: A strong ox does not pull straight when we plough fields. REVISE

xvGroup.xn: पिंडालु पकाउँदा राम्रोसंग आगो बलेन भने पक्दैन ।
xvGroup.xe: If the fire is not strong enough, it does not cook well when we cook yam.

xvGroup.xv: ghole ŋôːnɛ miroɔmpo lagi bʌ̄ŋpɛ muʦhûː.
xvGroup.xn: धेरै रुनु स्वस्थ्यको लागी राम्रो हुँदैन ।
xvGroup.xe: A lot of crying is not good for the health.
Our things got mixed up.
Their sheep got mixed up.
The rice and the wheat got mixed.
Milk dilutes in water.
We need to come together to go to this marriage ceremony.
The curry was spoiled in the metal pot.
I don't know the way.
The landslide did not bury the house.

xvGroup.xv: ʔɛʣɛ̄ː ghʌ̄rpɛʔɛ lɛ̂l ghʌ̄rpɛ ɦʌs ʦʌptɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The first runner was caught up by the one who started running later. REVISE
The chickens are covered in the basket.
I filter the tea.
The dregs in the oil have to be filtered.
The mason built the house.

psGroup.gn: भाँडामा रहेको पेय पदार्थको अन्तिम थोरै परिमाण सिद्धयाउनु
psGroup.xn: बाजेले निगारको भाँडामा रहेको अन्तिम परिमाण सिद्धयायो ।
psGroup.xe: Grandfather finished the last drop of alcohol.

psGroup.ge: be poured to the last drop
psGroup.gn: निख्रिनु, निखारिनु, कुनै पनि भाडामा बाँकि रहेको (तरल पदार्थ)

xvGroup.xe: The last drop of alcohol in the jar has been poured. REVISE
The chilli is hot.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʔûŋ ʔiʦʉkʌtʌ mʌnʌ kîn phʉktɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले पहिलो औँलाले छेड्यो अनि झकडा भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: He pointed at me with his finger, and a fight ensued.
You should not point at a young cucumber with your finger.
We wrapped the fermented soybeans to take to the cowshed.

xvGroup.xn: हामीले त्यो थैलोमा सामल पोको पार्‍यौं ।
xvGroup.xe: We wrapped food supplies in that bag.
He prepared the things.
Ramrise prepared the rice flour.

xvGroup.xn: म गोठ जानुको लागी तयार भएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I prepared myself to go to the cowshed.
Grandfather's cheek has wrinkles.
The flour got spoiled.
The earth is hard.
The earth became hard.
Ramrise is very stingy.
I plucked nettle.
I close the door.

psGroup.ge: sieve (separate different grains on a flat basket by horizontal saccades)
psGroup.gn: नाङ्लोला‌ई दायाँबायाँ केही झड्का दिँदै च्याख्लको छिन्कौटो छुट्याउने तरिका

xvGroup.xe: I sieved the maize grains.
I chop the firewood into pieces.
I teach children at the school.
He taught me how to weave baskets.
We learn to sing songs.
Taste the beer, first-born!
He ground the maize in the mill.
Last year's wood is rotten.
I play with the small children.
The children play by themselves.
bad food.
It was not nice.

xvGroup.xn: गर्नु पर्ने काम रम्रो नहुँदा नमीठो हुँछ ।
xvGroup.xe: It is unpleasant when the work one has to do is not good.
He is not a nice person.

xvGroup.xv: phulu lōːle mʌgɵkdebi ʣɵkbi ɦoɔ̄i ʔimʌçkilo ɦɛpiŋʌ ʦɛʔissiki.
xvGroup.xn: चेरो नभाएको ठाउँमा भोज खानु बलायो भने निक्‍कै अप्ठ्यारो लाग्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: If we are asked to participate in a feast by a family with which we do not have have mutual dealings, we feel uncomfortable participating.
Young man, put some extra load (in your basket).
I put bedding on the basket.
Rain leaked from the roof of the house.

xvGroup.xv: wɵ ʦɛppɛ gɵ̄ːthɛbi ghrot munɛ mughāːnu.
xvGroup.xn: पानी चुहिने गोठमा बाख्रा बस्‍न मान्दैनन् ।
xvGroup.xe: Goats do not like to stay in a leaking cowshed.
I can carry the load.
I can remember.

xvGroup.xv: kokpɛ ɦʌs kokpɛ mʌ̂ntɛsilo ʦʌkpɛʔɛ ʔʌ̄m mʌri ʦɛ̂ːpsetɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उ जान्‍ने हुन खोज्दा जान्‍नेहरुले धेरै जवाफ मार्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The one who pretended to be knowledgeable has been put in his place by more knowledgeable people.
I lost the key.
He startled me.

psGroup.ge: add a piece of bamboo to widen the opening of basket (progressively)

xvGroup.xe: He added a piece of bamboo to enlarge the basket.
I sharpen the plough with an adze.
The bamboo matured.
The pig matured.

xvGroup.xv: bɛpariʔɛ phʌ̄l khɛ̂i mɛnulo manabi phʌ̄l ʦōŋʦoŋ mʉsʌ thɛpnu.
xvGroup.xn: व्यापारीले पीठो बेच्दा मानामा पीठो झुसी पारेर बेच्छन् ।
xvGroup.xe: When the businessman sells flour, he weighs it by making a heap in the measuring pot.
I made a heap of flour in the measuring pot.

psGroup.ge: push half-burned firewood deeper into the hearth

xvGroup.xe: Please push the firewood from that side.
He annoyed me.
He sprang to hit the ball.
The deer jumped away.
I chop firewood with an axe.
I chopped the pumpkin with a khukuri.

psGroup.ge: cut (a little bunch of fodder that one handles in one hand)

xvGroup.xe: He cut branches to give to the cows.
I pay my debt to him.
He swept the courtyard.
The snow is cold.
When we boil tomatoes, their skin comes off.
The landslide engulfed his fields.

xvGroup.xv: bhlʌçpɛ tēlʔɛ ʦɵʦʦɵpo ʔukhʌ̄rbîm sʌkʌ ghlêː ʦhʌ̂ntɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उम्लेको तेलले बच्‍चाको हातको छाला ख्वात्तै लग्यो
xvGroup.xe: The boiling oil peeled off the skin on the child's hand.
He chewed the whole sugarcane.

xvGroup.xv: ʦɵʦʦɵ ŋêiʔo ʔɛ̂nnɛʔɛ, ʔumɛ̂mʔɛ jʌ ʦhʌptɛ.
xvGroup.xn: बच्‍चा बिरामी हुन्छ कि भनेर आमाले सुर्ता गरिन् ।
xvGroup.xe: The mother worried about her child being sick.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌnɵ̂l senɛ ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʔûŋ mukde ʔiʦhimʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: आज राती उसले मलाई ओछ्यानमा धकेल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: Last night he pushed me to the other side of the bed.
The chicks push each other when they feel cold.

psGroup.gn: अरुले पाए जति कसैले नपाउँदा हुने असन्तुष्टि

xvGroup.xe: The mother in law is not satisfied with her daughter in law's work.

xvGroup.xn: उस्को खानेकुरा थोरै हुँदा असन्तुष्टि भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: He felt unsatisfied as he did not get enough food.

xvGroup.xn: नसघाएकोमा उ देखि म असन्तुष्ट छु ।
xvGroup.xe: I am dissatisfied with him for not helping me.
When we go to a meeting, it is not good to be late.
It was nice for me.
I became big.

psGroup.ge: become wiser (of a child growing up)

xvGroup.xe: The child became reasonable. (He is old enough to understand right and wrong)
The smart rooster crowed early in the morning.
I cut the fig tree for fodder.
I cleaned the crushed maize.
He hated us (the children).
I rinsed the pan with water.

xvGroup.xn: खोलाले चप्लेटि ढुङ्गामा भएको माटो पखाल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The stream washed the soil from the stone slab.

xvGroup.xv: mamasisi ʔʌusʌdhi ʣɵnɛ munʉ ʔɛ̂nnɛ ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʔʌnûː ʔiʦhestʌ.
xvGroup.xn: जुन्सुकै औषधी खान हुन्‍न भनेर उसले मलाई सावधान गरायो ।
xvGroup.xe: He warned me not to take medicine carelessly.
Let's get to know each other.
I recognized a lophophorus!

psGroup.ge: know each other, be acquainted with

xvGroup.xv: purne nɵ̂l kɵ̂mʔɛ mugʉ̄ːlʉkho lɵ ʦhēldʉ.
xvGroup.xn: पूर्णेको दिन बादलले ढाकेन भने जून चम्किलो हुन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The moon shines brightly on full moon day if it is not obstructed by the clouds.
The child starts speaking very late.

xvGroup.xn: बत्ती मधुरो मात्र देखियो प्रस्ट देखिएन ।
xvGroup.xe: The lamp just flickered and did not light up.

xvGroup.xv: ʔɛ̂ntosoba ɦek bʌʣi go kɵ ʦhēldʉ ?
xvGroup.xn: आजकाल कति बजे पो उज्यालो हुन्छ ?
xvGroup.xe: What time does the day break these days?
The lice spread.
Majamlaal's goats became very numerous.

xvGroup.xn: पोहोर सालको धानको बीउ मैले फैलाएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I multiplied last year's rice seeds.
I expanded the number of chicken.
He ignited the fire with a flintstone.
He ignited the fire.
I made a fire for myself.
He is addicted to alcohol.
You are addicted to singing.
Angry dogs bite people.
I mixed hot water with cold water.
He exaggerated.

psGroup.ue: This verb differs from <khopt> in that one gather things with both hands in front of oneself, while with <khopt> one gathers towards oneself.

xvGroup.xe: He gathered the millet seedlings and made a bundle by tying them together.
Gather bamboo and make it into a bundle.
The children dance in the school.
We danced a lot during the Waas festival.
Now let us have a meal.
When we are sick, we have to take medicine.
I paint the house.

xvGroup.xn: मैले सेतो लुगा रातो रङले रङ्य्याउँछु ।
xvGroup.xe: I dyed the white piece of cloth red.
What time is it?

xvGroup.xv: khɛ̂l mɵ̂l mʉnɛ lagi ghole ɦʌskolo ʣenɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: We have to discuss Khaling affairs with many people.
He speaks nicely.
His jew's harp sounds nice.

xvGroup.xn: बाटोमा उसले मलाई बोलाउँदा पो चिनेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: When he called to me on the road, I recognized him.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ bideslʌ ɦɵpɛ brâː sāːphʌm ʣettɛ.
xvGroup.xe: He read a letter from abroad.
The shaman calls his master.
We get to know each other by talking.
As I did not have an umbrella today, I got wet from the rain.
He made us wet.
He grew the rice seedlings.

psGroup.ge: get warm by the fire / get coolness (when one feels too hot); adjust one's temperature to surroundings

xvGroup.xe: He gets warm by the fire.

xvGroup.xn: चिसो हुँदा आगो ताप्‍नु मजा आउँछ ।
xvGroup.xe: When it is cold, it is nice to get warm by the fire.

xvGroup.xn: गर्मी लाग्दा हावा ताप्‍नु मजा आउँछ ।
xvGroup.xe: When it is hot, it is nice to have a cool wind.

xvGroup.xv: lonɛmbi tori tēlʔɛ klênsinu mʌnʌ noɔ̄m ʣhʌtnu.
xvGroup.xe: In the winter, they rub themselves with oil and bask in the sun.
It is not good to encourage people to do bad work.
He encouraged us to plough the field.
The pumpkin rotted.
The potato spoiled.
The meat spoiled.

psGroup.ge: be fed up, be bored, drink enough water

xvGroup.xe: I am fed up of working too much.

xvGroup.xn: दिनहुँ सुँगुरको मासु खानुले वाक्‍कै लाग्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: I am bored of eating pork every day.

xvGroup.xv: ʔumôː ʣhîmtɛ̂m sʌmmʌ mesʔɛ ku tʉ̂ŋtɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The buffalo drank water until it was satisfied.
The thief escaped.

xvGroup.xv: nus tɛ̄ːlâm sʌ̄ŋ mɛ̄ːlâm sʌ̄ŋbi ʣʉkkhɵstɛ.
xvGroup.xn: बादर एताको रुखबाट उताको रुखमा हाम्फाल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The monkey jumped from tree to tree.
As the alcohol was sour, he did not drink it.
With a tight sieve, one can sift fine flour.
He cut the tree.
It lasted for a long time.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌnʌ̄m ʔʌmɛ̂mʔɛ pʉtɛ̂m thoɔpru mʌri ʣhêŋtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उहिले मेरो आमाले बुनी दिनुभएको पटुकी धेरै खप्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The girdle that my mother wove years ago lasted a very long time.
People in old days used to live a very long time.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌnɵ̂l ʣhɛ̂ːpkho ghole kɛ̄m mʉnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: सकियो भने आज धेरै काम गर्नुपर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: Today, if possible, we have to do a lot of work.
Today we have to do all the work.
The cow got lost in the forest.
The child is terrified in the forest.
I plough the field.
I waded across the stream.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m ʔʌ̂mtɛsilo ʔukhîːmɵ ʣhɵ̂rtɛnʌ dhāŋku ʣhistɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उ सुत्दा र्‍याल चुहेर सिरानी भिज्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: While he was sleeping, his saliva leaked out and the pillow got wet.
He became thin because of the hardships which he endured this year.

xvGroup.xn: सुँगुरको मासु पोल्दा बोसो बिलेर चुह्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: When we roasted pork, the fat dripped.

xvGroup.xn: गर्मी बढ्दा खोटे सल्लाको खोटो झर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When the temperature increases, the pine resin comes out.

xvGroup.xn: मैले उस्को सुन्तला खाएर मन राखीदिएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I satisfied myself by eating the orange he offered.
He put the book on the table.
The chicken laid an egg.
The vertical pole supported the horizontal one.
He was drunk and could not stand on his feet.
Point the torch (in that direction).
He got tired and rested his load on the platform.

psGroup.ge: have misfortune after having done bad things

xvGroup.xe: The cow died and flies laid eggs on it.
When we do bad things, we suffer from misfortune.
I step on the stone.
He pressed with his thumb (on the colour) as a seal.
My hands got numb from the cold.
I got cold in the snow.
I do not smoke.
We did not drink much beer.
I play cymbals.

xvGroup.xv: ʔīːʦiʔɛ thōːʦi ɦōːtɛlo lêl mʌri tʉpiti.
xvGroup.xn: हामीदुईले ऋतु फेरिदा धेरै गीत बजायौं ।
xvGroup.xe: We played many songs during the change of season.
Blacksmiths make khukuris.

xvGroup.xv: dʌbu doro mʉpɛʔɛ mʌri bhîr tʌ̂mtɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The hunter tracked the deer for a long time.
The jackal tracks the chicken by its smell.
The snow broke the tree's branches.
The cow fell down in the steep rocky place and broke its leg.
I uprooted the fern shoot.
He uprooted the bamboo shoot.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m khelbi ghlâŋtɛlo woŋâmpo ʔunɵ tʉ̂rtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उ खेलमा जित्दा अरुका नाक भाँच्यो
xvGroup.xe: When he won the game, he disappointed other people (who hoped that they would be the winners).
During the months of Chaitra and Vaishakh, one cannot stand the heat of the sun.
I could not look directly at him (due to shyness).

psGroup.ge: feed (an animal parked in an enclosed area an unable to feed by itself)

xvGroup.xe: He raised an orphan.
I raised a pig.
I have to survive on my own.
He blocked the waterpipe with grass.
He blocked the entrance to the porcupine's burrow.
He put the fermented alcohol (in half-solid form) into the round clay container.
He squeezed clothes into his bag.

xvGroup.xv: plenbi bhērnɛkʌ lɛ̂l ʔʌŋeʦobi khapsi têntʌ.
xvGroup.xn: प्लेनमा उड्नु भन्दा पहिले मेरो कानमा रुवा खाँदेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: Before flying, I put wool into my ears.
Where did he flee after stealing?

xvGroup.xv: dʌbu mʉpɛʔɛ bʌndukʔɛ bhîr ʔɵ̂ːptɛlo tʌkkhepbi ŋʌ phali têrsʉtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: सिकारीले मृगलाई बन्दुकले ताकेर एकैचोटिमा ढाल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: As the hunter brought down the deer with one blow.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ sʌ̄ŋpo khāŋ poɔ̄ndʉʔɛ phali têrtʌ.
xvGroup.xe: I knocked down the tree with an axe.
A child does not break his mother's heart.
He plucked out the rice seeds.

xvGroup.xv: lūːʣʌ saro mʌçkilo sāŋ tēlnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: When we weed the millet field, we have to uproot weeds.
I pick my ear.
He wormed (the secret) out of him.
Don't pick your eyes.
Stones fell from the cliff.
The cow fell from the bridge.
It is getting late.
Where did I drop the money that was in my pocket.
He sowed the corn in the furrow.
They are dropping hooks (to fish) into the river.
He dropped the key.
The tongba is soaked.

xvGroup.xn: अमला मुखमा राखेर खाँदा मीठो स्वाद आउँछ ।
xvGroup.xe: Chewing aamla gooseberry is nice.
They chew betelnut.

psGroup.gn: खाना खाने बेला पीइने या खाइने अन्य वस्तु

xvGroup.xn: बाजेले खाना खादा पानी पिउने गर्नुहुन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When grandfather eats, he also drinks water.

xvGroup.xv: bhîr seçpɛ ɦʌsʔɛ tʌ̄m toksʌʔɛ tʌŋʌ lɵ̄ːmʉ
xvGroup.xn: मृग मार्ने मान्छेले नकराई सुनेर मात्र खोज्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The hunter hunts by silently listening to the deers.
The mother measured the ground with her arm to prepare the loom.
Mount Everest is visible form that hill.
These days dawn breaks at five o'clock.

xvGroup.xn: तिमीले बिर्सिराखेको खुकुरी मैले राखिदिएँको छु ।
xvGroup.xe: I kept for you the knife that you had forgotten.
You kept an orange for me.
I keep an orange for myself for tomorrow.

xvGroup.xn: सुन्तलाको बोटबाट सुन्तला झड्दा मैले समातेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: When the orange dropped from the tree, I caught it.
The parrot imitated a human voice.
I set a bhangra loom for myself.
I will push your load while you are carrying it.
He handed the matter over to me.

xvGroup.xv: mɛ kɛ̄m mʉnɛbi ʔʌ̄msu toɔ̄l lʉ̂iti.
xvGroup.xn: त्यो काम गर्न उनीहरु एकापस तत-मम गरे ।
xvGroup.xe: They are trying to pass off responsibility to each other.
He hammered the nail.
I sifted the beer.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ mâŋ ghole jûː lumu thaktɛ.
xvGroup.xe: He gobbled down a huge amount of rice. (impolite word)

xvGroup.xn: बच्‍चा भर्खर हिँड्न थाल्दा धेरै लड्छन् ।
xvGroup.xe: When children start walking, they stumble a lot.
The stone rolled down the cliff.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋ ʔudiʦʦhɛ kɵ mʌtoɔ̂i ŋʌ thīːstʌ.
xvGroup.xe: I woke up before dawn this morning.
He woke up the sleeping child.
From what (auspicious name) should we determine this child's name?
I start the discussion.
I start the discussion.
Who started the discussion?
Yesterday the bus did not run.
Children move a lot.
I run the house.
I drive the bus.
I use a khukuri.
I took a loan from the bank.

lxGroup.ge: work and serve during special occasions

xvGroup.xe: We have to perform the service.
I was pricked by a thorn.
We are hurt by nasty words.
Cows gore people.
They celebrate Indrajatra by dragging the wagon.
He dragged down (from the mountain) the highland bamboo for making mats.
We have to extract the nettle fiber.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ khɵleŋʌ sɵ̂r tûː phɛʣijʉ thʉ̂mtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले सबै चामल एउटा थैलोमा जम्मा पार्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He collected all the rice in one sack.

psGroup.ge: cling to, be attached to, be mixed with

xvGroup.xv: rɵ̂ː jâː mʉ̂n belabi ɦiloʔɛ ʔʌgɵ thettɛ.
xvGroup.xn: धान रोप्‍ने बेलामा लुगामा हिलो लाग्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: When we planted rice, mud got onto my clothes.
Nettle curry mixed with flour is nice.
I was smeared with mud.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ baʣi gōːtɛlo ʈhoʈʈo ghoɔ̄lpɛ lūŋ thêntɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले बाजीमा धेरै ठूलो ढुङ्गा उचाल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: During the competition, he lifted a huge stone.
It is not possible to lift the big load.
It is not good to entice people to fight.
The ship floats on the water.
I erect the pole for a cowshed.

xvGroup.xv: krʌ̂msʌŋ ʔuŋʌ disɛ̂: kholunʌ kʌ̄m tūŋbi theru.
xvGroup.xn: भोलि म आराकाठ ओसारेर घरमाथी ठड्याउँछु ।
xvGroup.xe: I will transport the sawed wood planks tomorrow and lean them (on a terrace) above the house.
I leant against the stone.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ kɛ̄m mɛlo dhɛpɛ-dhɛpɛ ʔubhittʌbi tʌŋʌ thērdensi.
xvGroup.xn: उसले काम गर्दा घरी-घरी भित्तमा मात्र बस्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: He leans against the wall from time to time when he works.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʔûː kaktɛlo ʔukhʌ̄rpo sʌsʌrwɛ thêltɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले बारी खन्दा औँलाको छाला छिलियो ।
xvGroup.xe: As he hoed the field, the cuticle at the base of his nails came off.
The storm blew off the roof of the house.
He took off the bamboo mat in order to move the cowshed.
The cow took off the bark of the Ficus sarmentosa and ate it.
He passed away last year.
The rope snapped.
The cow snapped the rope and went to the fields.

xvGroup.xv: mesʔɛ ribʌ lʌpʌ thɛttɛnʌʔɛ dhōːʦer kɵ̂ːkbi khɵstɛ.
xvGroup.xn: भैँसीले दाम्लो चट्टै चुडाएर गहुँ खान गयो ।
xvGroup.xe: The buffalo snapped the rope and went to eat the wheat.
He spits all the time.
I snap the rope.

xvGroup.xv: jʌkʌ̂m bʌ̂iʔɛ ʔuribʌ lɛ̂ː thɛttɛ. (lʌpʌ thɛttɛ)
xvGroup.xn: त्यो गाईले उस्को डोरी चटक्‍कै चुडाल्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: That cow violently snapped its rope.
I weighed the meat.
We measure the wood and cut it.
He saw a snake.
I saw you in my dreams.
How much wage does he get?
I did not understand.
I did not understand what you said.
There was a heavy rain yesterday.
We thrashed a lot of rice.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋ bʌ̂i sēipɛ muŋʌtʌlo bʌ̂iɦɛm ghʉ̂rtɛnunʌ mʌri thoɔptʌnu.
xvGroup.xn: गोठाला बस्दा गाईहरु कुदेर धेरै पिटेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: When I was a shepherd boy I used to hit my cattle when they ran away.
The (ground) of the house that was plastered a while ago already came off.

xvGroup.xv: kʌrʌi tate ʦhʉktɛlo jûːpo pɛphɛm thɵ̂rtɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The crust of the millet porridge came off as the pan became hot.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuʦɵ rêːnɛ ʣênnɛ ʦēisinɛbi ʔubʉi ʦhʉktɛlo ʔumɛ̂m pɛpsu thoɔ̂rsetɛsu.
xvGroup.xn: बच्‍चा लेखाई पढाईमा प्रथम हुँदा आमाबुवा खुशी भए ।
xvGroup.xe: The parents were happy when their children topped the class in writing and reading.
I stirred the millet paste.
I feel like eating.
I feel like singing a song.

xvGroup.xn: उस्को बच्‍चा धेरै किचकिच गर्ने गर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: His child often bickers (with his parents).
When he was a child, he did not use to bicker.
When I was a child, I did not use to bicker.
The curd coagulated.
The blood coagulated.
The lamb is able to follow its mother.
He followed me.
Let's resume work.

psGroup.ue: This verb has a special meaning when apply to potatoes, as illustrated by the following example:

xvGroup.xn: आलु या कुनै खाने कुरा पकाएपछि लामो समय पानीमा राख्दा हुने नमीठो स्वाद वा अवस्था ।
xvGroup.xe: The potatoes became spoiled after being left too long in the water after cooking.
He became badly sick with a cold.

xvGroup.xv: ʦʌkpɛ mʌ̂ntɛsilo jakki ʔʌbrâːʔɛ ʔʌ̄m pʌ̂m dîltɛ.
xvGroup.xn: जान्‍ने हुँदा मेरो सानो कुराले उ डल्लो पर्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He pretended to be very knowledgeable but was not able to answer my simple query.
He rolled a cigarette and gave it to me.

xvGroup.xv: tôː pɵpɛ mɛ̂mʦʉnʉʔɛ sɵle pʌ̄mdel dîltɛ.
xvGroup.xn: तान बुन्‍ने आमैले धागोको डल्लो बेर्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The weaver rolled the ball of thread.

xvGroup.xv: mes goʈhalaʔɛ gɵ̄ːthɛ joktɛlo bhʌkari dîltɛnʌ kʉ̂rtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: भैँसी गोठालोले गोठ सार्दा भकारी बेरेर बोक्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: As the buffalo shepherd moved the cowshed, he rolled the bamboo mat and carried it.

xvGroup.xv: jakki lɛ̄mbi soɔ̄rpɛ ɦʌs dūŋ lʉsʌ lɛ̄m thinu.
xvGroup.xn: सानो बाटोमा धेरै मान्छेहरु ठेलाम्-ठेल गरेर हिँड्छन् ।
xvGroup.xe: The people walking on the small path push each other. REVISE (many)

xvGroup.xn: कुनै बेला भेडाहरु भीरमा एक अर्कामा धकेला-धकेल गर्छन् ।
xvGroup.xe: Sheep often push each other on the cliffs.
We will meet later at the school.
We will meet at the conference room.
The box myrtle (Myrica esculenta) ripened.
The tomatoes ripened.

psGroup.ge: be able to keep away bad spiriʦ (shaman)

xvGroup.xe: The shaman was unable to keep away the misfortune.

xvGroup.xv: rôː khudoʔɛ ʔiseçki molo ʣɵkbi ʣɵkbi ʔɛ̂n ni ʔûŋ mʌsêiŋʌ, ʔʌroɔ̄mʔɛ dênkhʌtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: भिर मौरीको महले मात्छ, तर खाँदा-खाँदा अब त मलाई मात्दैन, मेरो शरीरले पचिसक्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: Wild honey intoxicates people, but having had it again and again, I can now resist and not get intoxicated.
It is possible to lift this stone.
It is possible to do that work.
I tasted the salt.
We tasted bear meat.
I have enough rice.

psGroup.ge: take, hold (in both hands, in a pitcher) something coming from above

xvGroup.xe: I get water from the tap.
He received the tika from his grandfather.
The hunter made a trap for the porcupine.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ thālbi jûː mʌnʌ supbʌlbi koɔ̄i doɔttɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले थालमा भात अनि कचौरामा तर्कारी थाप्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He took the rice in a plate and the curry in a bowl.
I collected water in a pot while it was raining.
Water accumulated on the leaf of the taro.
I dug potatoes from morning to evening.
The mouse dug its way into the house.
My grandchild asked me for money.
I bumped the stone hard.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋ patel khɵstʌlo laskʌbi ʔʌsɛ̂l dhuktʌ.
xvGroup.xn: म हग्‍नु जाँदा मेरो खुट्टा ठोकेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: As I went to the toilet, I bumped my leg.
I connect the threads.

xvGroup.xv: ʔōːʦuʔɛ nala ʔunɵtʉ ŋʌ dhʉkutunʌ ku ghole jestu.
xvGroup.xn: हामीले मुहानमै पाइप जोडेर पानी धेरै ल्यायौँ
xvGroup.xe: We connected the pipes to the spring and brought a lot of water.

psGroup.ge: be on good terms, be similar, fit together

xvGroup.xe: They are on good terms.

xvGroup.xv: tɛ kɛpbi mɛ kɛp ʔukhroɔ̂m dhʌ̄m.
xvGroup.xn: यो भाँडामा त्यो भाँडाको बिर्को मिल्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: That pot's cover fits into this pot.
The colour of the thread is the same as that of the flower.

xvGroup.xv: reɖijobi dhʌ̄mpɛ bɛʈri bekki khôŋ ʣe.
xvGroup.xn: रेडियोमा मिल्ने ब्याट्री लगाए मात्र बज्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The radio will only work if you use the right battery.
I blew on the fire.
During the was festival, we blow horns.
I wiped my tears.
I wiped my plate.
The river washed away the tree.

psGroup.ge: suit, not to be allergic to

xvGroup.xe: The phenga and dhajura (Khaling traditional dress) suit me.
The sheep thrived under his care.
I am allergic to the dhobi nut tree (Semecarpus anacardium).
He is allergic to goat manure.

psGroup.ge: be friends; have an illicit relationship

xvGroup.xe: They are not on good terms.
They had an illicit relationship and ran away.
The green wood dried.
He straightened the dented pot.
He is handsome.

xvGroup.xn: मेरो कुरा बिग्रदा उसले सोझ्याई दियो ।
xvGroup.xe: I spoke wrongly, and he corrected me.

psGroup.gn: कसैको उपयोगी वस्तु वा सम्पति अरु कसैलाई काम लाग्नु वा उपयुक्‍त हुनु, लाभ् हुनु, फाइदा हुनु

xvGroup.xe: Your book is useful for me.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuphōŋʔɛ ʔujâŋʦo kʌ̂rtɛ̂m gɵ ʔʌ̄mbi mudhʉ̂mwɛlo ʔûŋ go ʔidhɵrʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: काकाले भतिजलाई ल्याईदिएको लुगा उस्लाई नमिल्दा मलाई काम लाग्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The clothes that the uncle had brought for his nephew did not fit him, so I benefited.

xvGroup.xv: thūːnɛm phɛ̄rbîm ʣɛkoɔ̄i sâːwɛsaʔɛ ʣɛnʌ, bele mudhoɔ̄rki.
xvGroup.xn: जङ्गल छेउको अन्‍नबाली जनावरले खाएर त्यत्ति उपभोग गर्न पाइँदैन ।
xvGroup.xe: The crops grown near the forest are eaten by animals, and we do not get all of them.
Yesterday we piled up firewood.
What did you eat to become so fat?

xvGroup.xv: ʔɛnɛ ŋeçpɛ muŋʌtʌ molo ʔɛ̂n ni nʉŋʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: अस्ति बिरामी थिएँ तर अहिले सन्चो भएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I was sick but I recovered.
This year the rice grew well.
He rubbed the foxtail amaranth.
They wrestled.
I squeezed tobacco for myself.
Cover your noses!

xvGroup.xe: I am thinking how to do the work.
As his lover remembered him, he got a hiccup.

xvGroup.xv: ʦɵʦʦɵ muŋʌtʌlo bhʌ̄ŋte ʦēiwʌsukho nōːwɛ rʌ̄iʦhʌ mʌ̄msiŋʌ.
xvGroup.xn: सानो छँदा राम्ररी सिकेको भए राम्रो हुन्थेछ भनेर सम्झन्छु ।
xvGroup.xe: I thought that it would have been good to learn well while I was a child.
I stayed for two days in town.
Where do you live?
Are you well?
I harrow the rice field.
He sings nice songs.
He made a nice talk.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuʦɵ mâŋ mʌttɛ? ʔuʦɵ melsêm mʌttɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उस्को बच्‍चा के जन्म्यो? उस्को बच्‍चा छोरी जन्म्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: What did he have? He had a girl.
This year, we obtained good crops.
I start singing.
We start working.

xvGroup.xv: ʔubʌ̂iʔɛ ɦʌspo bali kʉtnu mʌnʌ nôː mʌttɛnu.
xvGroup.xn: उस्को गाईले अर्काको बाली खायो अनि उस्लाई तिरायो ।
xvGroup.xe: His cows ate other people's crops and he was fined.
My mother called me to eat meal.
The rice did not bear good fruits.
The rice bore good crops.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʣhola ʦɛ̂mtɛ mʌnʌ kʌ̄m ɦōːtɛnʌ mɛ̄lmʉl mʌ̂ntɛsi.
xvGroup.xn: उसले झोला हराएर घर आउँदा अनुहार खस्कियो ।
xvGroup.xe: He lost the bag, and as he came home he felt ashamed of himself.

xvGroup.xv: ʔugɵ ʣhɛ̂mtɛlo ʔʌ̄mʔɛ miːlâm dēlbîm ɦʌs mʌ̂rtɛnu.
xvGroup.xn: उस्को लुगा हराउँदा तल्लो गाउँको मान्छेहरुलाई शङ्क गर्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: When his clothes disappeared, he suspected the people from the lower village.
The bear bent the wheat.
The wind bent the rice.
The shaman healed the (morbid) humor.
He uprooted the millet seeds.

xvGroup.xn: आईमाईहरुले एकआपसको केश भुत्ल्याएर झगडा गरे ।
xvGroup.xe: The girls fought and pulled out each other's hair.
He stirred the millet porridge.
Because he was sick, he vomited.
I vomited violently.
I soak my clothes.
He soaked the rice seeds.
I had a nice dream.
The river is very large in summer time.

xvGroup.xv: ghorapo ʔumêr sōŋpɛ mʌnʌ mōŋpɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: घोडाको पुच्छर लामो र ठूलो हुन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The tail of a horse is long and thick.

xvGroup.xv: ghiu jo mɵstɛ bîrmɵ jo khɵstɛ.
xvGroup.xn: घिउ पनी सक्यो बिरालो पनी गयो ।
xvGroup.xe: The butter is finished, the cat went away.
The mouse finished off the grains.
I moved around groping in the dark.
We felt the thief's body.
The water spilled.
I spilled water.
He spilled my tea out of anger.
I beat him.

psGroup.gn: खुसुक्‍क चोर्नु, खुसुखुसु चोर्नु या चोरी गर्नु

xvGroup.xe: I sifted buckwheat flour.
The crab made holes and the water went through them.
The rat took away the grain little by little.
When we add yeast in the alcohol, it becomes sweet.

xvGroup.xv: bāŋdaʔɛ rʌpʦuʔɛ goru jālto ʔûː ʣhɵ̂ŋtɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The simpleton ploughed the field by beating the ox with a stick.
The policemen beat the thief.
Tomorrow I will have time to go to work.
Connect the pipe that snapped!

xvGroup.xv: ɦulubi sʌ̄ŋ jʌpkhʌtɛ, woŋâm sʌ̄ŋ ɦʌ̂nnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: अगेनामा दाउरा डढी सकियो, अरु दाउरा पोल्नु पर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The firewood has been entirely burned, we have to add some more firewood.

xvGroup.xn: निगार बनाउने मान्छेले घैँटोको टुटी बुच्‍च्यायो ।
xvGroup.xe: The wine maker took off the lid under the earthen ware.

xvGroup.xn: बाबाले गाली गर्दा उस्को कुरा बन्द भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: He stopped talking when his father scolded him.
I squeezed the lemon.

xvGroup.xn: मैले बिँडमा लाहा लगाई खुकुरी तताएर जोडेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I fixed the khukuri's handle.

psGroup.ge: be irresponsible, neglect one's duties, be careless

xvGroup.xv: bʌ̂i ku bʌ̂nnɛ mʌçpɛ, ʔʌnɵ̂l jʉmʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: गाईलाई पानी खुवाउनु पर्ने आज बेकाममा भुलेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: It is my responsibility to give water to the cows, but I forgot today.

xvGroup.xn: उ बिग्रियो, उस्को घर पनि ढल्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He was careless and his house crumble down.
Ripe bananas are nice.
The tomatoes ripened on the tree.
He came down.
I brought wood from the forest.
I brought sunpati from the highlands.
The child reached school age.
It is time to harvest the millet.

xvGroup.xv: ʔɛ̂n ni rɵ̂ː raru jôː mʉnɛ jêːtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: अव त धानको बिउ बेला (छिप्यो) भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: Now the time to transplant rice has come.
When I ploughed the plough got damaged.
The pole to attach the cows gets damaged when we hammer it.
I blinked.
He endures a lot of hardship at home.
I suffer from a wound on my leg.
It is too late to harvest wheat.
I want to dance.
He likes bread.

xvGroup.xn: पहिलेदेखि उनीहरु एकापस मन पराएका छन् ।
xvGroup.xe: They have liked each other for a long time.
When we whet our sickle, it becomes sharp.
I distribute sweets.
I distribute sweets to the children.
He moved the cowshed.
The butter was melted by the sun.
The snow melted.
We avoid whistling inside the house.

xvGroup.xv: dēlbi ɦʌs mʌ̂nnulo ʔûːbi kɛ̄m mʉnɛ tunɵ̂l jōŋki.
xvGroup.xn: गाउँमा मान्छे मर्दा बारीमा काम गर्न एक दिन बादना गरिन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When someone dies in the village, people hold off working for one day.
What do I look like with a hat?
What did they look like when they went to the market?
He looks like his mother.
We crushed chilli into powder.
I smashed the clods of earth on the rice field.

xvGroup.xn: खेल्नु भन्द अगाडी जिउ तताउनु पर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: Warm up before playing.
They slice cucumber and sell it.

xvGroup.xv: negi mʉkilo pôːposɵ joɔ̄rsʌ negi nokʦhoʔɛ rʌdʌm mɛ.
xvGroup.xn: नागी पूज्दा सुँगुरको मासु चिरा पारी नागी पुरोहितले विधि गर्दछ
xvGroup.xe: When we worship the Nagi, we slice pork and the priest performs the ceremony.
The shaman made a prediction.
The water washed it onto this side of the river.
He got dizzy.
He shook his head.
When he came from the funeral, he sprinkled him with water.

psGroup.ge: encourage (a child who is not doing well)

xvGroup.xe: He made the children do the work by encouraging them.
The tiger followed the sheep.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋ sīmʔɛ ʔiristʌnʌ sʌpʌr ʔimʉstʌ, mʌnʌ nokʦhoʔɛ dhup ɦʌttɛnʌ nʉŋʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: मलाई नाग लागेर खटिरा आयो अनि धामीले धूप लाएपछि निको भएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I was hexed and I got itchy, then the shaman burned incense and I got better/
I was hexed by a demon and my belly swelled.
I twisted the thread.
The spirit made him sick.
The sun disappeared behind the hill.

xvGroup.xn: उनीहारुले पानी पर्दा ओडारमा ओत लिए ।
xvGroup.xe: As it rained, they took cover in a cave.
I knead bread.
A stone rolled down from a steep place.
The dung beetle rolled some dung into balls.
I jerk the towel.
The shaman trembled.
I shivered from the cold.
I trembled as others argued.
The earth cracked as it was dragged by the landslide.
He cut the tree.
I winnowed the millet.
I cut the tree from the middle.
He is badly angry.
The vine coiled around the tree.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌʣoŋʌ khɵstɛ, ʔɛ̂n ni ʔudhʌ̂m rʌ̂mtɛ ɦolʌ.
xvGroup.xn: अघि नै गयो अब त डाँडा कट्यो होला ।
xvGroup.xe: He went ahead and may have passed over the ridge.
The cow coiled the rope around the pole.
Write me a letter.

xvGroup.xn: मन नपरेको मान्छेलाई सबैले छिछिदुरदुर गर्‍यौँ ।
xvGroup.xe: We all despised the people we did not like.

xvGroup.xn: उस्को बोली बिग्रदा हामी धेरै हास्यौं ।
xvGroup.xe: When he said something wrong, we laughed a lot.
As the two children made jokes with each other, I laughed (at their jokes).

xvGroup.xn: हामीले राम्रो काम नगरे अरु हास्छन् ।
xvGroup.xe: If we do not do good work, people will laugh at us.
I whetted the axe on the whetting stone.
He was standing on the trail.
I respect my parent's words.
They are making offerings of chicken to the forest god.
I settled in a nice place.

xvGroup.xn: उहिले हाम्रो पूर्खाले राम्रो जामीन रोजी राख्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: Long ago, our ancestor settled in a nice place.

xvGroup.xn: आमा काममा जाँदा उस्को नानी पनि जान खोजेर रुने अवस्था ।
xvGroup.xe: The child did not want to part with his mother and cried as she went to work.
He hit the cow with a slender stick.

xvGroup.xv: kʉ̂r kʌ̄rkilo ʔukhot lɛ̄mbi sɵ̂ː rɛ̂ːp.
xvGroup.xe: We get tired walking uphill with loads.
The clothes were burned.
The bread was burned by the fire.
When I used the iron, the clothes were not burned.
I take the baby in my lap.
He used my khukuri.
Bamboo water containers crack when they dry.
Walnut is nice when it is well dried.

psGroup.ge: hit the target, reach a goal

xvGroup.xe: He shot the target but missed it.

xvGroup.xv: jûː koɔ̄iʔɛ rɵ̂ːtɛ go je murɵ̂ːtwɛ go?
xvGroup.xe: Do we have enough food or not?

psGroup.ge: have to do something because one is the relative of someone else

xvGroup.xn: भोलिको बिहामा हामी पनि जानु पर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: As we are relatives, we also have to go to the wedding ceremony tomorrow.

psGroup.ge: make a hole from the bottom

xvGroup.xe: The mouse made a hole in the millet bag.
The river laid bare the root of the tree.
The goat made a passage under the fence and ate the millet.
The maggots bore holes in the meat.
The mule tumbled and broke its leg .
I smashed the pumpkin.
He concluded the talk.
I loaned money.
We went to the bank to take out money.
I have to take money from him.
The cow reached for the higher branches of the tree and ate some leaves.

xvGroup.xn: कुकुरले मेरो हात चाट्न मन पराउँछ ।
xvGroup.xe: The dog likes to lick my hand.
I put clothes on the cupboard.
They crossed the mountain by now.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ɦebelojo ŋʌ ʔubhâːtʌ thēmbi mʌnʣi lakdetʉ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले जहिले पनि उस्को काँधमा मजेत्रो राखी राख्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: He always puts a shawl on his shoulders.
When Nirime puʦ a scarf on, it fits him very well.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûː ʣhōŋkilo gorupo ʔubhâːtʌbi ʣowa lândensi.
xvGroup.xn: बारी जोत्‍दा गोरुको कांधमा जोवा बसिरहन्‍छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The yoke lies on the oxen's shoulder as we plough fields.
The lizard is lying on the stone.
The chicken has stopped laying eggs.
I threaded the needle and sewed the clothes.
As I ran, I twisted my foot.
He flipped the page of the book.
The landslide turned over the stones.
I dip the potato in the chilli.
He lighted a cigarette for me.
I added yeast into the alcohol.
The potatoe sprouted.
He started a business and is flourishing.
I feel cold.
I feel hungry.
I felt thirsty.
It is sunny.

psGroup.ue: Can be translated as "to think" when used with ɦêŋ "as"

xvGroup.xe: I think that he is a nice man.

xvGroup.xv: mʌri noɔ̄m nōːtɛnʌ, mi phɛ̄rbi mukkhêŋ lōːtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: धेरै घाम लाग्यो आगो नजिक बसे जस्तै लाग्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: It was very sunny, it felt like sitting by a fire?
Children play on the swing.
The bean seeds from before were destroyed.
He destroyed the sugarcane.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋ gɵ sūːnɛ po lagi lûnsiŋʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xe: I bent to pick up the clothes.
The bamboo has a bent tip.
I told him the words that my mother said.
As it was cold, I put a second layer of clothes.

xvGroup.xn: बुबाले भन्‍नु भएको कुरा दिमागमा घुस्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: I repeated to myself the words my father told me.

psGroup.gn: धामी झाँक्रीले आफ्नो विषेश कपडा लगाउनु

xvGroup.xe: They adopted a family name.

xvGroup.xn: मृत्यु सँस्कार गर्ने धामीले उस्को कपडा लगायो ।
xvGroup.xe: The shaman put on his garb.
He partially boiled the meat.
I dropped the stick (by mistake)
He released the sheep in the forest (to graze).

xvGroup.xv: kʌmʌ̄i mʉtôŋ mōːtɛ̂m ʔûː tɛ palakʌ lêːsʉtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: खेतिपाती गरी राखेको बारी पनि यस पालीदेखि छोडीदियो ।
xvGroup.xe: He was producing crops but from this time he abandonned the field.

xvGroup.xv: solariʔɛ phɵ khoɔttɛ mʌnʌ khlêːpʔɛ koɔ̂ltɛlo, phɵ phlʉ̂ː lêːtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: स्यालले कुखुरा लग्यो अनि कुकुरले खेद्दा कुखुरा छोडी दियो ।
xvGroup.xe: The jackal took away the chicken, but when the dog chased it, it released the chicken.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ phaplu khoɔ̂nnɛ ɦêː lʉ mʌ̄msiŋʌtâm tɛ pala lʉ lettʌ.
xvGroup.xn: मैले फाप्लुको ठाउँ कस्तो रहेछ भन्दा एस पाली देखिनै थाहा पाएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I wondered what Phaplu was like, but this time I have experienced it.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m ʔipdɵktɛlo lokpheiʔɛ kɛ̂ːtɛm lʉ mulênwɛsi.
xvGroup.xn: उ निदाएको हुदा जुकाले टोकेको महसुस गरेन ।
xvGroup.xe: He fell asleep, so he did not realize he was bitten by a leech.

xvGroup.xv: khepɛ ɦʌs ribʌ bhɛ̄ipɛʔɛ mʌri lʉ lettɛ̂m sʌmmʌ rɛ̂ːptɛ.
xvGroup.xe: The policeman beat the thief in such a way that he felt it.
I feel that I ate my full.
I came to visit my friend's house for a short time.
I will visit you at your house tomorrow.
The snake swallowed the frog.

xvGroup.xn: कालेगोरुले मालेगोरुलाई कान्लामुनी खसाईदियो (‌काले र माले: गोरुको नाम)
xvGroup.xe: Kalegoru pushed Malegoru down the terrace wall (names of oxen).
The sun dazzled my eyes.
We poured the water from the pitcher into a metal pot.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ ʔʌtapʔɛ ŋʌ dʉt lēndunʌ tuŋu.
xvGroup.xe: I pour milk for myself and drink.
He changed clothes.
He did not slide into the river.
He slid down the terrace wall.

psGroup.ge: put on a chopping board, put sth. under sth. else to raise it or make it level

xvGroup.xe: Having put the meat on a chopping board, I cut it.

xvGroup.xv: karɖborɖbi lepsʌ rekkilo ʔʌʦher bʌ̄ŋpɛ ʦhûː.
xvGroup.xn: कार्डबोर्डमा सापेर लेख्‍दा अक्षर राम्रो हुन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When we write by putting (the paper) over a cardboard, the letters are nice.
When I carry loads, I put a pad on (my forehead).
This is too sweet!

xvGroup.xv: ʔīːʦiʔɛ ʦɵʦʦɵ lēmnɛnʌʔɛ ʔûː kâː mʌ̂nnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: हामीले बच्‍चालाई फकाएर बारी खन्‍नु लाउनुपर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: We have to exhort the children to hoe the field.
We have to soothe the fighting people.
As the child cried I soothed him.
I take the clothes out into the sun.
Take out the dishes!
Put forth your strength!
The smoke brings out tears in our eyes.
He came down the ladder.
Rice headed out.
The banana tree matured and grew fruits.

psGroup.ge: take out, bring out (of an enclosed location)

xvGroup.xe: I take out the pot.
Take the goaʦ outside.
The fire caught on the thatch.
An epidemic infected the chicken.
We walked at lot yesterday.
Be careful while walking on the small path!
The festival was auspicious.

psGroup.ge: turn over (eg. potatoes that are not homogeneously cooked)

xvGroup.xe: The porcupine dug up the potatoes.
I turned over the uncooked potatoes.
He was hit by a stone and his head was hurt.
He damaged my pot.
He put his hand into the pot.
He put his hand in somebody else's bag.
I will fetch your things in the shop.
He fetched his friend's letter.
The buffalo cow miscarried.
I caught a fish.
We caught a dove a while ago (by hand).

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ suntʌlapo khāŋlʌkʌ ɦʌ̄mpɛ suntʌla ʔʌtappo lagi loɔ̂msiŋʌtʌ
xvGroup.xe: I caught for myself an orange that fell down from the orange tree.
My eyes winked involuntarily.
His hand has a nervous tick.
I am looking for firewood.

xvGroup.xv: ʔokpo dēlbîm ʦɵʦʦɵ ʣhɛ̂mtɛnʌ loɔ̄mnɛ mʌçpɛ gɵ.
xvGroup.xn: हाम्रो गाउँको एउटा बच्‍चा हराएकोले खोज्नुपर्ने छ ।
xvGroup.xe: A child in our village is lost and we have to look for him.
I collect firewood for myself.

psGroup.ge: miss a spot, miss someone when distributing something

xvGroup.xe: As he sowed wheat, he missed a spot.
The grass grew a lot.
The pipal tree has grown very big.
My leg got entangled in a rope and I nearly fell down.

xvGroup.xv: ʔɛ̂n ni ʔʌ̄mʔɛ ʔudhʌ̂m ŋʌ wetkhʌtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: अब त उसले डाँडा काटी सक्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He has passed the ridge by now.
The sun crosses over the horizon at five o'clock.
He crossed over the ridge earlier today.
The bag is hanging on the peg.

xvGroup.xn: चोया केलाउँदा कर्दोले उस्को हात काट्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: He sliced his hand with the knife as he peeled the bamboo.
He crunched the pop-corn and bean snack.
The cow ate the grass with a crunching sound.
She gave birth to a child yesterday.
I chop highland bamboo.
He chopped down the banana tree in one strike.

psGroup.ge: be disappointed (after having had great expectations)

xvGroup.xv: pɛpʔɛ kitap ʔikʉrʌtʌ mʌ̂mtɛsi, molo ʦɛ̂mɦɵ̂ːtɛ. mɛbelo rɛʣɛ wɛ̄ːsmestɛ.
xvGroup.xn: बाबाले किताप ल्याइदियो भन्ठान्यो, तर बिर्सेछ र छोरा झुकियो ।
xvGroup.xe: The eldest son thought "Father will bring me book", but his father forgot and the son was disappointed.
He scooped the water.
The wild cat cried.

psGroup.ge: be pierced by a thorn or a sharp object (in the foot)

xvGroup.xe: Yesterday I was pierced in the foot by a thorn.
I sleepwalked during the night.
I fell into the hole.
I did not mind his words.
After I warm the water, I have a bath.
He shouted at the animal.

xvGroup.xn: मेरो बहिनीको घरमा तिमी पहिला पस्यौ ।
xvGroup.xe: You entered my sister's house first.
You entered first in order to see me.
He climbed into the tree.
We all fit into one room.
How many fit in the bag?
I collected scattered grains.
I bring the cows into the cowshed.
Pass me that curry over there.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m ʦhʌ̄rmɛ kʌ̄m khɵstɛlo daksu sʉtɛ.
xvGroup.xe: As he went to his father-in-law's house, he greeted him.
I choose nice clothes.

xvGroup.xn: मन जस्तो भएन अनि उ पलापिए ।
xvGroup.xe: It did not happen as he wanted and he abandonned his family.
I string beads.
The louse moved from the clothe onto me.
The two children asked the ploughman.
The apple tree bears fruit.
Last year much grain was produced.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌʣhɛ̄mnu ʔɛçsʌ ʔʌtēm rɵ̂ː tūŋ sîːtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: पोहोर सालको भन्दा यसपाली बढी धान फल्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: More rice was produced this year than last year.
The lazy husband was abandoned by his wife.
I was sick and I gave up drinking.
The bird abandoned its nest.
The shaman has healed me.
He put muzzles on the goats.
I insert the splint of the basket.
I pick up the grain that has fallen on the ground.
He picked up this expression from his friend.

psGroup.ge: take the grain / fruits off a branch by pulling the whole bunch while leaving the branch behind

xvGroup.xe: He harvested the buckwheat into the basket.
A monkey damaged the rice.
I cut the Ficus sarmentosa.
He picked all the chillis.
The winter came and the water dried up.
The swollen belly and shrank.

psGroup.ge: cheat (by intentionally hiding part of the amount)

xvGroup.xv: tuju kɛ̄m mʉkilo, dʌrʌm sʌ̄mnɛ munʉ.
xvGroup.xn: संगै काम गर्दा सथीलाई फसाउनु हुँदैन ।
xvGroup.xe: We we work together, it is not good to cheat one's friend.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ khɵle khɛpʦi sēi mumʉwɛ, ʔûŋ ʔisʉmʌtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले सबै रकम देखाएन मलाई फसायो ।
xvGroup.xe: He did not show me all the amount and cheated me.

psGroup.ge: become numb (due to lack of circulation)

xvGroup.xe: My leg became numb.
My hand is numb.

xvGroup.xv: ʔusūːtʌ ʣɵkîm sasrus bʌ̄ŋpɛ sʌ̄rsʌ tʌŋʌ ʣɵnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: काँचै खाने फलफुल मजाले धोएर मात्र खानुपर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When we eat raw food, we have to eat only fruits that we have washed.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m patellʌkʌ ʔɵstɛnʌ sabʌnʔɛ ʔukhʌ̄r sʉ̂rtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उ चर्पीबाट फकेपछि साबुनले हात धोयो ।
xvGroup.xe: As he came back from the toilets, he washed his hands with soap.
The tiger tracked the ghoral (position before attack).
I sieved the millet.
I take out the grains and winnow the husk.
They cleared the trail.

psGroup.ge: kill, cause to be drunk, cause to get motion sickness, end

xvGroup.xe: The tiger killed the deer.
He did not get drunk.
He finished the edge of the basket.
I got poisoned by the wild honey.
I have motion sickness in the car.
He cooked the yam after removing the damaged parts.
The rope is tight.
I tighten the load of grass.
The cow has tightened the rope and it is impossible to untie.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌmɛ̂m pɛpʔɛ ʔilʉstâm brâː ʔʌnûːbi sɛttûŋtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: आमा बुबाले भनेको कुरा मनमा साँची राखेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I kept in mind my parents' words.
I covered the banana.
When we cook yam, we have to cover it.

psGroup.gn: पानी उम्लानै लागेको बेला स्यार्र गर्ने अवस्था

xvGroup.xe: The water is going to boil soon.
The sky made hissing sound yesterday evening.

xvGroup.xn: डोरीको भुवा आएर गाईलाई बाँध्न थेग्दैन ।
xvGroup.xe: Since the rope is worn out, it cannot be used to tie down a cow.
I winnowed the grains.
He cut the top branches of the Ficus sarmentosa.

xvGroup.xn: उ बिरामी हुँदा धेरै दुब्लो भयो ।
xvGroup.xe: He became sick and lost a lot of weight.
His hair is very long.
The matchmakers' discussion was very long.

psGroup.ge: pach down the ground around a pole

xvGroup.xe: We packed down the ground around the pole.
They lost at football.

psGroup.ge: salute, pass over to someone (from a distance)

xvGroup.xe: I salute my parents.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ thaŋra bektɛlo ʔuŋʌ mʌkʌ̄i ʣhuta soɔttʌ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले थाङ्रो लाउँदा मैले मकै झुता दिएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: While he was piling up the wooden support (for drying corn), I passed out the bunches of corn to him (throwing them from the ground)

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m pʌtei mumʉwɛnʌ ghogʌ soɔttɛ (lɛ̂ː soɔttɛ).
xvGroup.xe: He did not believe him and made a gesture of insult.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ gɵ̄ːthɛ jo pɛp loɔ̄mʣʌ soɔtpɛtɛ.
xvGroup.xe: He has taken food to the cowshed for his father.
I reduced the price of the goods.

xvGroup.xv: sʌ̄ŋ dhuma ghrɛɦelo, mi soɔ̄inɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: दाउरा धेरै बल्दा आगो ओझ्याउनु पर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When the firewood burns too much, we have to reduce the fire.
I got full from the rice.
My father smoothed the bamboo.
The river smoothes the edges of the stones.

psGroup.ge: run along, flow along a surface (water)
psGroup.gn: पानी या तरल पदार्थ कुनै वस्तुको माध्यमबाट बहनु

xvGroup.xe: The rain ran along the cable and the house got wet.
The goat followed the stream.
I washed the clothes.
The ploughman beat his two oxen very hard.
We met a lot of people in the meeting a few days ago.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄m ʔunûː soɔ̄rpɛ mumîmʔɛ khɵle ʔimʌ̄mki.
xvGroup.xn: उ मनकारी भएकोले हामी सबैलाई सम्झन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: He is generous and thinks of us all.
He has a lot of sheep.
I open the box.
If we do not cook taro properly, it tastes pungent.
The chilaune (Schima wallichii) causes an itch.
The kauso caterpillar causes an itch.
The child felt frustrated, as his father did not give him his toy.
He cut the tobacco.
I took off the bamboo's knot.

xvGroup.xv: jâmʔɛ ʔusesmɵ ʣetnulo theprippo ɦibʉnɛm ɦinɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xn: झाँक्रीले गुरु पूजा गर्दा तितेमालिङ्गोको फुर्के बनाउनुपर्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: When the shaman worships his master, he has to make a bamboo staff with fluffy bamboo shavings on one end.
I cut the millet stalks (left on the ground after harvest).
The porcupine cut many corn stalks.
The alligator chopped off the cow's feet.
I covered the child's cradle with a blanket.
I winnow the corn.

xvGroup.xn: मैले दाल र आलु तर्कारीको लागी मुछेँ ।
xvGroup.xe: I mashed the potatoes with lentils to make curry.
When we eat nettle, we have to rub it with a spindle.

xvGroup.xv: rɵ̂ː jâː mʉkilo dateʔɛ ɦilo ɦʌ̄lnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: When we plant rice, we have to stir up (the field).
I churn the butter-milk.
The dog barked.
I will wait for you.

xvGroup.xv: ʔīːʦiʔɛ dokosi ʣɵkbi ɦɵpɛ nus ɦʉŋi.
xvGroup.xn: हामी मकै खानु निस्किने बाँदरलाई पर्खन्छौ ।
xvGroup.xe: We wait for the monkeys who are coming for the corn.
I will come slowly, wait for me on the other side of the ridge.
The bush fire burnt the forest.
My hand was burnt in the fire.
He burned firewood.
I burned the meat.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ woŋâm khespɵ ɦʌttɛnunʌ pulis loɔ̂pbi ɦōːtnu.
xvGroup.xn: उसले पोल लगाएपछि अरु चोरलाई पक्रन प्रहरी आए ।
xvGroup.xe: He revealed (the identity of) the other thieves and the police came to catch them.

xvGroup.xv: ʔīːʦiʔɛ ʔʌmbʌk lūŋʔɛ ʔoɔpsʌ ɦʌ̄mnɛ mʌttʉ.
xvGroup.xe: We have to throw a stone on the guava to make it fall.
I washed my head today.
The mother washed her child's hair.
When it it hot, we have to wash our hair.
The wind blew the fire up.
We fan the fire.

xvGroup.xv: ʔudiʦʦhɛ miʔɛ ʦuloluŋ ɦʌ̄rdʉlo ʦhɛ̂l ɦɵnu.
xvGroup.xn: बिहानी चुलोतिर आगो भुर्भुराउँदा पाहुना आउछ भन्‍ने किम्बदन्ति छ ।
xvGroup.xe: If the fire blows up to the hearthstone in the morning, guests will come.
When he prepares beer, he adds yeast.

xvGroup.xv: ʔuŋʌ lʌ̄ŋkhiʔɛ ʦi ɦʌ̂rtʌnʌ lʉpɛ mûŋtʌ
xvGroup.xe: I added yeast to the beer, and made it strong.
After the yeast ferments, the beer becomes strong.
When we feel hot in the summer, we have to use a fan.
I cut the millet.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ sambule ɦekdetɛnʌ mɵ̂l khoɔ̄mbi khɵstɛ.
xvGroup.xe: Wearing a bag on his shoulder he went to the conference.

xvGroup.xv: sambule ʣhola ɦêndênpɛ, darʣiliŋ khoɔ̂nnɛ ʣêndênpɛ.
xvGroup.xn: साम्बुले झोला भिरेको, दार्जिलिङ जान बोलेको ।
xvGroup.xe: Carrying a bag, speaking of going to Darjeeling. (excerpt from a song)
He is really hardworking.
This khukuri is sharp.

psGroup.ge: dry (reduce the amount of water), die

xvGroup.xe: The boiling water dried off.
I hug my friend.
I crossed the ridge.

psGroup.ge: make a slight cut, slice (with a sharp blade, piece of paper or the leaves of some plants)

xvGroup.xe: I was cut by the grass.

xvGroup.xv: nɵ̂rʔɛ ghrot ɦɛ̂ntɛ, molo kɵnɛ muʦɛ̂ːpwɛ.
xvGroup.xn: बाघले बाख्रालाई खान खोज्‍यो तर सकेन ।
xvGroup.xe: The tiger tried to kill goat, but could not eat it.

xvGroup.xv: nokʦhoʔɛ ʦhʌ-khɛp ɦɛ̂ntɛnʌ, sat-khɛp-bi khʌ̄rko wɛttɛ.
xvGroup.xn: धामीले ६ पटक भुम्तेर सातौ पटकमा खर्को काट्‍यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The shaman made six attempts at cutting the kharko and cut it the seventh time.

xvGroup.xn: भोलि गहुँ टिप्‍न जान आँटेको वा लागेको ।
xvGroup.xe: I am thinking of harvesting wheat tomorrow.
My foot got stuck in the door.

xvGroup.xn: हामी खेत जोड्दा ढुङ्गामा हलो अल्झिन्छ ।
xvGroup.xe: The plough gets stuck on stones when we plough fields.
I dried the millet.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mɦɛmʔɛ khɛ̂i mʉnɛpo lagi khɵrsɛ̂i ɦɛ̂mtɛnu.
xvGroup.xe: They dried chilli in order to sell it.
We spread our legs.
You arrived yesterday.
The bamboo husk came off.
I removed the paper that was stuck on the wall.
I shouted at the cow.
He shouted at me.
I sent him a bamboo beaker.
I sent him money.
He sent me a letter.
The terrace wall collapsed during the monsoon.

xvGroup.xv: ʔʌ̄mʔɛ nʌja lɛ̄m bʌnei mʉnɛpo lagi purano lɛ̄m ɦɵ̂ːtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: उसले नयाँ बाटो बनाउनलाई पुरानो बाटो भत्कायो ।
xvGroup.xe: He destroyed the old trail to make a new trail.
There was a landslide during the monsoon.

xvGroup.xn: उ बिरामी हुँदा धेरै स्वाँ स्वाँ गर्‍यो
xvGroup.xe: A few days ago he was sick and panted a lot.

xvGroup.xv: rogi goru ʔûː ʣhōŋkilo mʌri ɦoɔssedʉ.
xvGroup.xn: रोगी गोरु बारी जोत्दा धेरै स्वाँ स्वाँ गर्छ
xvGroup.xe: When we plough fields with a sick ox, it pants a lot.
We pant a lot when we walk in the highlands.
I brought wood from the forest.
The shaman practiced an enchantment for the first time (in his life).
He drew a deep breath.
This year the rice grows stalks but bears no grains.

xvGroup.xv: ʔûŋpo ʔʌmelsêm phikbi khɵstʌlo woŋâmʔɛ ʔʌbrâː ɦoɔ̂nsʉtnu.
xvGroup.xn: मेरो केटी माग्न जाँदा अरुले मेरो कुरा खुलाइदियो ।
xvGroup.xe: As I was on my way to propose my girlfriend, other people revealed my intentions.
Don't tell this secret.
He ate the porridge.
We had soup.
As he did wrong, his father scold him.
His belly became swollen because of the cold.
His foot became swollen after being bitten by a snake.
My body was swollen after a hornet stung me.
When new bamboos grow, the husk comes off.
Some time ago we shelled corn.

xvGroup.xn: बच्‍चा बिरामी भएर धामीले सातो उकास्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: As the child got sick, the shaman protected his soul from the dead spirits.
I open the door.
He is displeased today.

lxGroup.ge: lift up or stretch to obtain momentum to strike

xvGroup.xn: सुँगुरलाई हान्‍न धनु उजाई रहेको थियो ।
xvGroup.xe: He stretched his bow to shoot the pig.

xvGroup.xv: sʌ̄ŋbi khɵstʌlo lʌɦʌrʌbi bhɛ̂mthiŋʌtʌnʌ ʔʌlʌ̄ŋ rîlsûŋtʌ.
xvGroup.xn: दाउरामा जाँदा लहरामा अल्झेर लड्दा डोको गुल्ट्याई पठाएँ ।
xvGroup.xe: As I was going to fetch firewood, my feet became entangled in a vine and I stumbled and dropped my basket.

xvGroup.xv: mʌlo gekpɛ buplaʔɛ kānla dha lʉkhʌtɛ.
xvGroup.xn: भक्खर कोरलेको चल्ला कान्लो मुनि खस्यो ।
xvGroup.xe: The chick that just went out fell down the terrace wall.
